availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christopher Baker Smith (Louisville, Kentucky, hat merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, hat merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Anna E. Bottorff Smith in Clark County, Indiana, on May 10, 1856. Father of Charles Smith and William Smith. Hat merchant in partnership with Thomas W. Pollard and James W. Prather in Pollard, Prather, & Smith, in Louisville, Kentucky, from 1852 to 1855. Hat merchant in partnership with James W. Prather and Donald McNaughtan in Prather, Smith, & Company in Louisville in 1856. Hat merchant in partnership with James W. Prather in Prather & Smith from 1857 through 1865. Hired two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
